projects.title: DIRTY BUSINESS
projects.subtitle: Mapping Mass Movement Operations in the Oslo Region
text: In a period of less than seventy years, millions of cubic meters of earth have been displaced across the Romerike plain—with bulldozers imported from America in the 1950s, ravines systematically filled, streams buried in pipes, and quick clay deposits destabilized—transforming a post-glacial landscape into an infrastructure of risk, erosion, and forgetting.

Using Digital Terrain Model differencing techniques, we analyze land movements between different time periods using DTM data from Kartverket. The investigation reveals systematic patterns of terrain manipulation that have transformed the landscape of the Oslo region over seven decades.
projects.quote: The landscape is not innocent. Every surface conceals a history of displacement.

images.caption: Skredkart over Romerike med inntegnet fjell i dagen og større sand- og grusavsetninger

projects.title: RAVINEVANDRING
projects.subtitle: Protection of Ravines North of Oslo
projects.meta: Public engagement and spatial documentation · 2023 – ongoing
text: Through public walks, spatial documentation, and alternative planning proposals, we sustain a movement for the protection of ravines north of Oslo—building alliances between residents, researchers, and activists to confront the ongoing destruction of these critical ecological corridors.

The ravines of Romerike are not just landscape features—they are living systems, drainage networks, and habitats that have been systematically filled, piped, and erased in the name of agricultural efficiency and urban development.
projects.quote: To walk the ravine is to read the wounds of the territory.

images.caption: Exposed drainage pipe in eroding quick clay · Romerike 2023

projects.title: BACKHISTORY
projects.subtitle: Scream from the Ravine — An Archive of Environmental Violence
text: Decades of newspaper clippings, technical reports, and photographs documenting floods, landslides, contamination, and terrain destruction across the Romerike plain. This archive traces the long history of environmental neglect and institutional failure that has shaped the region.
Romerikes jord, elver og vassdrag forgiftes av miljøgifter fra gamle og ferske kommunale og private fyllinger og industri. Of the ten most dangerous landfills in Akershus, seven are in Romerike.
projects.quote: Vi vet aldri når et ras skjer i slike områder. Eller om ras i det hele tatt skjer.

about.title: ABOUT
text: Laboratory for Urban Boundaries was founded by Anne Marie Aure, Paolo Ricci, and Thibault Felix to challenge and reconfigure the frameworks of urban development.
We are a collective of architects and researchers who support grassroots movements for ecological and social justice through spatial interventions and participatory design strategies.
Our methodology emphasizes long-term relationship building and knowledge co-production with local residents. We focus on building bridges between communities and institutional planning bodies.
We are actively seeking partnerships with organizations, communities, and researchers working on spatial justice and environmental protection. Please contact us if you have ideas for collaboration.
